text:
e="preserve">Roy Dana Call (February 16, 1950 – February 27, 2020) was an American actor. He appeared in several movies including "48 Hrs." (1982), "Brewster's Millions" (1985), "At Close Range" (1986), "No Man's Land" (1987), "Colors" (1988), "Born on the Fourth of July" (1989), "Young Guns II" (1990), "State of Grace" (1990), "Waterworld" (1995), "Murder by Numbers" (2002), "Babel" (2006), and "Into the Wild" (2007).
He was born in Ogden, Utah. Call was of the Mormon faith. He died on February 27, 2020 from back surgery-related problems at the age of 70.

annotations.surface_form: Born on the Fourth of July
